titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Allen Gilliland, Judgment
CWG6613

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Cumberland Circuit Court

Commonwealth Plff
against } Indictment for Sellng liquor to Soldiers,
Allen Gilliland Deft

This day came the Defendant as well as the attorney for the Commonwealth and on his motion and by consent of the attorney for the Commonwealth confessed himself indebted to the Commonwealth of Kentucky in the Sum of Ten dollars.
It is therefore ordered and adjudged by the Court, that the Plaintiff recover of Said Defendant the Sum of Ten Dollars and the costs therein expended and he may be taken

a copy
att
J. M Boles clk

Commonwealth
v } Copy Judgement
Allen Gilliland
